request.description:
This is the 1st request of the CIBA flow.

Check our guide here [https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/backend](https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/backend)

Check the proper purpose to use for each API in the request documentation at the Service APIs folder.

E.g. for SIM Swap `dpv:FraudPreventionAndDetection#sim-swap`

urlencoded.description: Fixed value for this authentication method

request.description:
This is the 2nd request of the CIBA flow.

Check our guide here [https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/backend](https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/backend)

In case the purpose used in the 1st step needed end-user consent, it should be captured in an out-of-band flow.

urlencoded.description: Fixed value for this authentication method

request.description:
This is the 2nd request of the CIBA flow.

Check our guide here [https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/backend](https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/backend)

In case the purpose used in the 1st step needed end-user consent, it should be captured in an out-of-band flow.

query.description: Fixed value for this authentication method
According to the product's purpose and scope. Check Service API request's documentation
You will take de authorization code at this endpoint from the code parameter in the query string

request.description:
This is the 1st request of the Auth Code flow.

Check our guide here [https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/frontend](https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/frontend)

Check the proper purpose to use for each API in the request documentation at the Service APIs folder.

E.g. for SIM Swap `dpv:FraudPreventionAndDetection#sim-swap`

This request must be performed from the end-user's device since this authentication method consists of its IP address resolution to identify them. It has been included in this collection as a reference. Sending it from Postman just won't work, since the client must follow redirections until reaching the `redirect_uri`. In order to test it, copy the URL resolved with your values (you can find it in this very Documentation tab) and paste it in your browser running on the end-user's device.

You will need to publish an HTTP server to listen for the `redirect_uri` where the code will be redirected to.

item.name: 2nd Get access token with client secret (Frontend)

urlencoded.description: Fixed value for this authentication method
The one obtained at the redirect_uri provided to /auithorize
You will take de authorization code at this endpoint from the code parameter in the query string

request.description:
This is the 2nd request of the Auth Code flow.

Check our guide here [https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/frontend](https://developers.opengateway.telefonica.com/docs/frontend)

This request is supposed to be performed from your backend, from where you publish your `redirect_uri` listening for the code requested in the 1st step.

In case the purpose used in the 1st step needed end-user consent, it will redirect such first request to the proper consent capture web page previous to the redirect to your redirect_uri.

item.name: 2nd Get access token with private JWT key (Frontend)

urlencoded.description: Fixed value for this authentication method
The one obtained at the redirect_uri provided to /auithorize
You will take de authorization code at this endpoint from the code parameter in the query string
Fixed value for this authentication method
